text: The Mercedes-Benz EQE is a battery electric executive car produced by Mercedes-Benz. Part of the EQ family, the EQE was introduced at the 2021 Munich Motor Show. The car is produced in Germany and China. ==History== The EQE was presented at the Munich Motor Show in 2021, The first model available was the EQE 350 with a rear-motor configuration. Other versions, including the EQE 350 4MATIC, EQE 500 4MATIC, and AMG versions, were introduced later. These models offered varying power outputs and drivetrain configurations, including dual-motor all-wheel-drive systems. In 2022, high-performance models like the Mercedes-AMG EQE 43 and EQE 53 4MATIC+ were introduced, offering more power and additional features. The EQE 350+ was also launched with a longer range. ==Features== The Mercedes-Benz EQE is available in several configurations: The EQE can come with a rear-wheel-drive (RWD) or all-wheel-drive (AWD) dual-motor system. It uses a 90.6 kWh lithium-ion battery with a range of 459 to 660 km (285 to 410 miles) according to WLTP standards. The vehicle also supports DC fast charging up to 170 kW and AC charging options of up to 22 kW. The EQE 350 RWD offers 215 kW (288 hp) and acceleration from 0 to 100 km/h in 6.4 seconds. The AMG EQE 53 4MATIC+ can reach up to 505 kW (677 hp) with a 0–100 km/h time of 3.3–3.5 seconds. The EQE features a modern interior with features like a large infotainment display and driver-assistance systems. ==Markets== The Mercedes-Benz EQE is available in various markets worldwide, including Europe, North America, and Asia. ==References== Category:Mercedes-Benz automobiles
title: Mercedes-Benz EQE
